title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Friday 4 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: thousands of vials dumped in lay-by .
woman found dead on a38 in derbyshire .
drug dealer jailed for french smuggling trip .
racetrack funeral procession for motorbike enthusiast .
rugby : jones keen on tuilagi for autumn games .

documents.title: smugglers jailed over ferry cocaine haul
text: smugglers jailed over ferry cocaine haul

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's the end of our live updates for this week .
they 'll resume again at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: weather : mainly dry night ahead
text: it 's a dry and pleasant end to the day with plenty of sunshine before dark .
it remains dry overnight with clear spells at first however a few showers are possible by dawn .
minimum temperatures of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Anna Church
BBC East Midlands Today weather presenter

documents.title: drug taker walked through city centre with trousers down
text: a 35-year-old man has been jailed after walking through derby city centre with his trousers down .
police said scott taylor is believed to have taken formerly legal psychoactive drugs before the incident on wednesday .

he was jailed for 32 weeks by magistrates after admitting a public order offence , outraging public decency , criminal damage , two counts of shoplifting , stealing a bicycle , and vehicle interference .

tenielle hardwick , from derbyshire police , said : this incident shows the dangers of taking synthetic cannabinoids and that the user has no idea what is happening to them when under the influence of the substance .
scott taylor 's behaviour , in the middle of the day and in the city centre , was absolutely unacceptable .
people who visit our city do not deserve to be faced with someone exposing himself and acting in the way that he did . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : ex-england bowler shahzad on trial with foxes
text: former england fast bowler ajmal shahzad is on trial at leicestershire .
shahzad , who has played for yorkshire and nottinghamshire , is currently a free agent having been released by sussex last month .
the 32-year-old played one test match for england in 2010 against bangladesh and has also featured in 11 one-dayers and three t20 internationals .
author: Richard Rae
BBC Radio Leicester cricket reporter

documents.title: thousands of vials and syringes dumped in worksop
text: nine barrels full of what appear to be vials have been dumped in a lay-by in worksop .
bassetlaw district council said the unmarked items were found on the a57 near five lane ends along with a number of syringes .
the vials have been sent to a laboratory for analysis and the county council has sealed off the lay-by .
liz prime , from the district council , said : this is one of the worst fly tips we have ever seen in bassetlaw .
`` whoever has dumped this has done so without any thought or concern for anybody else , solely to make money .
`` this type of waste should be disposed of in a controlled manner , which will incur costs , not be dumped in a layby for the council tax payer to foot the bill for disposal . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham drug dealer jailed for french smuggling trip
text: a man who attempted to distance himself from a drugs smuggling operation has been jailed for ten-and-a-half years .
garvey barnes , 36 , of mansfield road , nottingham let his girlfriend carry a suitcase of cocaine onto a ferry from france to the uk .
kimberley brown , 27 , of walters row , dudley was arrested in dover in november 2015 .
officers from the national crime agency ( nca ) and border force found brown 's case had cocaine with a street value of up to £ 240,000 inside .
using mobile phone evidence , the pair were convicted of being concerned in the importation of class a drugs by a jury at canterbury crown court .
brown has been sent to prison for four-and-a-half-years .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : derby student plots one-way mission to mars
text: ryan macdonald hopes to be one of the first people to set foot on the red planet - even though it means he 'll never be able to come back .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: notts county sign forest 's yates on loan
text: notts county sign forest 's yates on loan

documents.title: football : 'first class ' forest ready for new season , says warburton
text: nottingham forest boss mark warburton claims his squad are in a `` good place '' ahead of their season opener against millwall tonight ( 19:45 ) .
forest , who are without the injured matty cash and jamie ward , could hand debuts to six players .
ex-rangers boss warburton told bbc radio nottingham : `` we are in a good place .
we had a good pre-season and we have good quality within the squad .
`` it 's foolish to make rash predictions or bold statements about where we will finish , but we know we have worked very hard .
`` the work ethic and commitment from day one of pre-season has been first class . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jake bugg premieres new tune
text: good news all you jake bugg fans - the nottingham tunesmith has just unveiled his new single .
how soon the dawn has a laid-back , summery feel .
listen here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hospital boss : parking problems should ease soon
text: the man in charge of the royal derby hospital says the new 600-space car park planned for behind the nearby aldi store should reduce parking problems for visitors .
gavin boyle , chief executive of derby hospitals trust , told bbc radio derby the extra spaces will be used by staff , freeing up places for patients nearer the hospital .
he also said in the long-term the hospital still hoped to build a multi-storey car park .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: scrapping midland mainline electrification is 'golden opportunity missed '
text: the east midlands chamber of commerce has written to the transport secretary to demand a meeting to try to persuade him to reconsider his decision not to proceed with the electrification of the midland mainline .
chris grayling said the decision not to electrify the line north of kettering through the east midlands would spare passengers the `` disruptive '' electrification work .
instead , the government said it planned to use bi-mode trains , which can switch between electric and fuel power .
but in its letter , copied to local mps as well , the chamber has urged the government to rethink its plans .
`` we are not convinced that the switch to bi-mode trains will result in the same level of improvements that electrification would bring , '' it reads .
`` we believe that a golden opportunity to enhance growth - for a modest investment against comparable projects - is being missed . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cash machine ram-raids 'linked '
text: cash machine ram-raids 'linked '

documents.title: manu tuilagi 'could be for autumn internationals , ' says jones
text: england head coach eddie jones has said he would be prepared to select manu tuilagi as early as the autumn internationals in november .
the leicester centre , 26 , has not played for england since march 2016 , and has been out of action since january because of a knee injury .
however , jones has tuilagi for a three-day pre-season training camp , starting on saturday .
`` if he 's fit and ready to go , we 'll play him , '' jones told bbc radio 5 live .
`` he demolished new zealand before , and if he 's fit and he 's got the right desire , then he 's always got a chance to get selected for us .
`` he 's got a number of club games to show us whether he is going to be right or not . ''
author: Chris Jones
BBC 5 live rugby union reporter

documents.title: your questions : who was polly bott of polly botts lane in ulverscroft ?
text: chris bell got in touch via leicestershire : your questions to ask `` who was polly bott of polly botts lane in ulverscroft ? ''
it would appear that not much is known about polly botts , so much that an internet search i did pulled up no information .
however , charnwood borough council pointed me in the direction of stoneywell , a national trust-run property nearby and they have been able to provide an answer .

paula nichols , assistant house and collections manager at stoneywell , said : `` polly bott was a resident of polly bott cottage ( which is still there ) , and this is situated just beyond the beck on lea lane .
`` in the 1950s the council wanted to re-name some of the roads and one of the gimson family ( possibly basil who was resident until 1953 ) put forward polly 's name .
`` there are various rumours about polly too .
some say she died of something grim - possibly tuberculosis , whilst others say she was a witch .
none have been substantiated but add to the mystery . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a38 reopens after woman 's death
text: the stretch was closed for a second time at about 11:30 after a woman died in a crash last night .
we 've now re-opened the s/b carriageway of the # a38 between # ripley & # kilburn after further investigative work has been completed .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : bakewell show organiser on 'worst ever conditions '
text: the organisers of this year 's bakewell show say this year 's event has been a `` disaster '' because of the muddy conditions .
the show is due to celebrate its 200th anniversary in two year 's time but janet bailey told the bbc the show was becoming less and less financially viable .
she said : `` we 're not in a healthy financial situation because we 've had a couple of years of weather like this . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : mixed-up weather in heage
text: mike swain 's beautiful shot of heage windmill sums up the mixed bag of weather we 've had this week .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: witnesses sought after woman 's a38 crash death
text: police say they want to hear from witnesses after a woman died in a crash on the a38 in derbyshire last night .
her body was found on the southbound carriageway between ripley and kilburn at about 23:00 .
the stretch was closed overnight and officers have blocked it again today to investigate further .
derbyshire police said : `` there are not believed to be any sus circumstances but we need to hear from as many witnesses as possible .
`` in particular , we want to trace the occupants of a car that was seen near to where the body was found .
`` we understand that one of the occupants of the car got out for a short time , before then getting back in and driving off .
`` we 're not sure precisely what time this car would have stopped but if you were driving along the a38 last night and you did pull over , we want to hear from you urgently . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man admits killing neighbour , 84
text: man admits killing neighbour , 84

documents.title: brian robson killing : neighbour admits manslaughter
text: a man has admitted killing 84-year-old brian robson , who died from head injuries after being attacked at his home in cosby in february .
the pensioner was found injured in his hallway in brooklands road after neighbours spotted 53-year-old peter bunyan kicking down his door .
he died at the scene .
police said bunyan , who lived on the same street , pleaded guilty to manslaughter at derby crown court and will be sentenced at a later date .
det insp chris barratt , the senior investigating officer , said : bunyan 's actions on that tragic day led to the death of a very much loved family man and devastated a family . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : scott carson on sunderland
text: derby county 's goalkeeper has been talking to bbc radio derby sport about tonight 's season opener at the stadium of light .
he told owen bradley that goalkeepers have to work just as hard as outfield players during pre-season .
listen below .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cash machine ram-raids 'believed linked '
text: two ram-raids at supermarkets in staffordshire and derbyshire which saw diggers used are believed to be linked , police say .
on wednesday , masked men used a jcb to try to steal the cash machine from the co-op on lichfield road , kings bromley , but escaped without it .
then yesterday , a digger stolen in tutbury , staffordshire , was successfully used to rip a machine from the wall of a nisa supermarket in hatton .
detectives in staffordshire say they believe they cases are linked and they 're working with derbyshire police as they investigate .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sinfin stink was down to waste plant testing
text: the operators of sinfin 's new waste treatment centre have admitted they were responsible for an unpleasant smell that wafted through the suburb on wednesday .
they said the manure-type odour , which several people said was strongest near b & q off osmaston park road , was a result of tests being run before the plant comes in to full use next spring .
they added immediate action was taken to resolve the problem .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mostly dry afternoon ahead
text: a fine afternoon with sunny spells and a few light showers although a lot of places should stay dry .
maximum temperatures of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: campaigners meet to try to save brain rehab ward
text: hospital bosses are being accused of deliberately trying to close down a unit that helps people with brain conditions .
sherwood forest hospitals trust plans to shut the chatsworth ward at mansfield 's community hospital .
the trust said the decision to close is not financial , but due to difficulties in recruiting specialist medical staff .
but jon dale , from the unite union , believes the hospital 's recruitment policy is not helping .
`` we know that they offered a consultant a six-month rolling contract and unsurprisingly he went elsewhere where he he could get more job security , '' mr dale told bbc radio nottingham .
`` if the trust were prepared to advertise a secure post and give this unit a future , they would get the specialist consultant that they need . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: holidaymaker asks chesterfield mp to check on house
text: some people expect a lot from our public servants
mps do get some odd requests .
just had gent pop into the office to see if we could check on his house every couple of days while he 's away !
well now i need to know what you told him ?
what time you going round ?
ca n't tell you that- it 's confidential .
perhaps you can make it reciprocal and he can keep an eye on yours when you 're in parliament
not sure mrs p would appreciate the attention .
why on earth would n't you do that ?
surely this was in the manifesto ?
that 's it , i 'm voting ukip .
good point .
under ukip no-one would be going away- problem solved !
would that have been a mr. j. prescott by any chance ?
no .
why do you ask ?
that would be because i would happily pop into his garage and check on his jag if he is away .
we are both old jag aficionados
i 've got a pile of ironing that i could really use some help with .
it 's a good idea to re-engage with community ; mp 's bob-a-job week .
erm toby - fancy a spot of gardening ?
can somebody pop into the town centre and keep an eye on that ?
seems that all the shops are closed and the homeless outnumber the shoppers
we 've got a gecko that needs feeding - only twice a week ?
can you feed my cat too ?
cheers toby .
hi toby .
my cousin mentioned the other day there was a lot of drug paraphernalia on stand road park .
is this something your aware of ?
perkins private security .
you mps and your second and third jobs .
we need a cat sitter would you mind popping in every few hours ?
thanks in advance .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : riverside festival to get under way
text: about 100,000 people are expected to turn out for nottingham 's riverside festival , which starts tonight .
dozens of rides are being set up along the victoria embankment for the three-day event .
the city council has said it 's confident everything will go ahead as planned , despite the recent wet weather .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : end of the road for leicester 's creative pitch patterns
text: we told you on thursday that leicester 's creative pitch designs are set to become a thing of a past due to new premier league rules .
it provoked quite a reaction over on the bbc radio leicester facebook page .
catherine ayrton writes : `` spoilsport !
creativity once again being ruined by people who do n't appreciate it . ''
spencer may adds : `` sad big up the grounds men tho impressive designs . ''
finally , jackie hurst commented : `` fun police have spoken ! ! ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: a38 to close again following woman 's death
text: this follows the discovery of a woman 's body along that stretch at 23:00 last night .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: greener washing machine : 'reservoir system would do the same job '
text: an in-depth technical discussion has broken out on our facebook page over a greener type of washing machine that 's been invented in nottingham .

blame roger swaine , who posted : `` i thought of this a few years ago ( yeah i know sure ) but i was thinking more of a reservoir so the first time the machine runs the tank fills first before filling the machine itself ( a simple overflow system ) .
`` the way the article is written it sounds more like they 're just proposing that the installers fill up the tanks and then seal them .
( might be wrong though . ) ''
join the debate here .
author: Facebook

documents.title: paper talk : interest in demarai gray
text: leicester city winger demarai gray 's future at the foxes is discussed in the bbc sport gossip column .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: notts to recruit 200 more police officers
text: nottinghamshire police plan to recruit 200 new officers between now and the end of next year .
the force says it also plans to take on more constables in 2019 until there are about 2,000 police to cover the county .

however , notts police and crime commissioner paddy tipping has warned the plans are dependent on what budget they 're assigned in november as well as the outcome of discussions on the government 's funding formula .
author: Lisa Teanby
Newsreader, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: watch : the new football season is here
text: i 'm really excited for the new season .
watch our east midlands guide below .
author: Natalie Jackson
BBC East Midlands sports editor

documents.title: watch : fire service to roll out pet oxygen masks to every station
text: here is leicestershire fire and rescue demonstrating how these pet oxygen masks ( see 09:53 ) work
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: burton and derby hospital bosses defend merger plan
text: the chief executives of the royal derby hospital and burton 's queen 's hospital say a proposed merger will not lead to a poorer service or job cuts .
the plan - which would see burton retain its a & e but stroke services moved to derby - has caused concern among patient groups .
but gavin boyle and helen scott-south said joining forces would help to improve and secure local services - as well as saving £ 35m over five years .
mrs scott-south said : `` we can secure our a & e - that 's really important to local people .
`` we can secure services .

if people have had a heart condition , they 'll actually be able to have the interventional part of that treatment here [ in the derby/burton area ] rather than having to travel across to leicester or up to stoke . ''
on jobs , she said : `` we 've got a lot of vacancies .
we 're not looking to lose staff .
they 're precious jewels we 're looking to keep .
`` this is a really important part of the next year - keeping our staff with us , not losing them . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : august across leicestershire
text: looks a lovely day for golf
thanks to bbc weather watcher craig the greenkeeper for this pic from birstall , leicestershire .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: analysis : stability key as forest begin the new season
text: this year , we know about the manager , he has got a proven record , we know about the director of football and we know there is stability behind the scenes .
we know that the players they have brought in will be suited to mark warburton 's style of play .
the stability is there at the moment , the signs are good that this period of stability will continue .
of course , above all else , what they always need is results on the pitch and tonight against millwall is a good place to start .
author: Colin Fray
BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: six in court over £ 66m drugs haul
text: two men from derby and nottingham are among a group of six people charged by police following the discovery of drugs with a street value of £ 66m .
uk border force officers stopped a van at docks in hull earlier this year and found 58kg of cocaine and almost 84kg of heroin .
the group , which includes four men from the north-west , appeared before magistrates yesterday and are due to appear at manchester crown court on 31 august .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire service gets oxygen mask sets to help pets caught in fires
text: each fire station across leicestershire will soon have a pet oxygen mask set to use when they attend fires .
the roll out across the county follows a successful trial at the end of last year .
it is hoped the the oxygen masks could save the life of pets involved in house fires and accidents .
the fire stations will be taking delivery of the sets over the next few weeks .
author: Amy Harris
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: amazing quilt charts four centuries of notts history
text: a patchwork quilt reflecting 400 years of nottinghamshire 's history has been unveiled this morning .

it 's been created by the notts branch of the quilters ' guild as part of bbc radio nottingham 's campaign to recognise the scrooby origins of the pilgrim fathers - who established one of the first english settlements in north america in the 17th century .
the quilt includes patches devoted to the river trent , boots , the goose fair , nottingham forest and robin hood .
it will go on display at nottingham 's tourist information office and the council house later this month before being gifted to the us .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lack of prosecutions following tool thefts from vans , figures reveal
text: less than 1 % of tool thefts from vans in leicestershire and rutland saw charges or cautions brought against an offender .
figures for 2014-16 , released by leicestershire police , show 1,507 reports were made in those three years .
further action was taken in just 14 of those cases .
det chief insp chris baker , from the force , said : `` we do carry out warrants , we do carry out searches and we do stop vehicles to try to recover what we believe may be stolen property .
`` however , unless we can prove that the items have been stolen , we can not proceed to a prosecution . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: new rams trio set to start against sunderland
text: derby county 's three summer signings - tom huddlestone , curtis davies and andre wisdom - are expected to start tonight 's season opener against sunderland at the stadium of light .
the black cats were relegated from the premier league last season and were this week rocked by dressing room drama involving darron gibson .
the game kicks off at 19:45 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police urge fans to be patient around trent bridge tonight
text: football supporters have raised concerns that there does not appear to be enough pavement space over trent bridge to get fans to and from the city ground .
over 25,000 fans are expected at nottingham forest-millwall tonight , with the match also coinciding with the first night of the riverside festival .
following the london bridge terrorist attack , concrete barriers were put up along trent bridge to coincide with the start of last month 's test match between england and south africa .
`` it is a very narrow gap between the pavement and the barriers , '' reds season ticket holder paul ashley-mchale said .

`` those barriers are not particularly high and the giddiness could quite easily lead to someone being flung over the barrier in front of a car , a bus or a lorry or even worse straight over into the trent . ''
nottinghamshire police has said it is urging people attending events in the area to be `` patient '' this evening .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: boss evans not 'hiding behind a bush '
text: boss evans not 'hiding behind a bush '

text: forest struggle not an option - warburton

text: derby unity surprised manager rowett

documents.title: watch : coffin taken round racetrack on sidecar
text: here 's jim richardson 's coffin making its way around darley moor raceway in a sidecar yesterday afternoon .
the unusual procession was organised by the 91-year-old 's family after he told them it was dying wish .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman found dead on a38
text: police say last night 's closure of the a38 was prompted by the discovery of a woman 's body at about 23:00 .
in a statement , derbyshire police said it believed the woman had been involved in a crash , adding : `` our investigation into the circumstances is continuing . ''
the southbound side was closed for several hours between ripley and coxbench but has now reopened .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: analysis : leicester sign kelechi iheanacho for £ 25m
text: he is 20 , he is an international , but he has got a point to prove because he has not been able to get into the side at manchester city .
they 've got some incredible strikers up there so he 's not been able to nail down a permanent place .
he 's quick , he has got a great eye for goal and his goal conversion rate is phenomenal .
£ 25m is a sound investment , i 'm really excited by this lad , he is the real deal .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: delays after animal crash in nottingham
text: if you 're stuck , this is why
a rtc involving an animal has occured on clifton boulevard causing tailbacks .
sure it was an animal and not just one of the locals ?
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: racetrack hosts speedy funeral procession for bike enthusiast
text: darley moor raceway near ashbourne saw a funeral procession with a difference yesterday .
a coffin containing the body of 91-year-old jim richardson was taken round the track in a motorbike sidecar .
it was jim 's dying wish , having been a biker in his younger years .
his son paul said : `` we were n't quite sure what to expect but once we 'd done the first circuit we were actually almost laughing .
`` we could n't believe what we were doing .
we could n't believe that he 'd wanted this to happen . ''
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: nottingham academics making washing machines 'lighter and greener '
text: researchers at nottingham trent university believe they have come up with a way to make washing machines more eco-friendly .
a ty budget washing machine is weighted by 25kg of concrete ( below left ) to stop it moving while on a spin cycle .
the alternative is a plastic container that is filled with water ( below right ) - but only once the machine is in place .
the team at nottingham trent university believes the change makes machines easier - and cheaper - to transport .
by replacing the concrete with empty containers , the weight of the machine is cut by a third .
if the change became standard , it would cut the weight of trucks carrying the machines which would in turn cut emissions .
the research suggests that with around 3.5 million washing machines sold annually in the uk , the new device could save around 44,625 tonnes of carbon dioxide emissions a year .
author: Roger Harrabin
BBC environment analyst

documents.title: a38 back open after overnight closure
text: the a38 southbound has reopened after being closed between ripley and coxbench overnight because of a `` serious incident '' .
we 're awaiting an update from derbyshire police on the nature of the incident .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

text: here 's how it is looking on the region 's highways :

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to friday across the east midlands .
gavin bevis and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live
